summary: REQ-12 watermark overlay was added via a root layout div and global CSS, but the required generated watermark image asset is not shown as added. REQ-11 contact details were updated in the footer, but the Contact page address in the info cards is not shown exactly as the single required string (it is split across two lines), and the Contact page map placeholder text update cannot be confirmed from the truncated diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Contact page contact information cards must show the updated address exactly as specified: "Lane 5, SISTER TELESYSTEM, Bapuji Nagar, Near Bank of Maharashtra".
missing_requirements.reason: In ContactPage.tsx, the address is split into two separate strings/lines instead of matching the exact single required address string.

missing_requirements.requirement: Contact page map placeholder address text must show the updated address exactly as specified.
missing_requirements.reason: The ContactPage.tsx diff is truncated before the map placeholder section; the updated map placeholder address text is not visible in the provided diff excerpt, so implementation cannot be verified.

missing_requirements.requirement: Use a static iPhone watermark asset from frontend/public/assets/generated (iphone-watermark.dim_1600x1600.png).
missing_requirements.reason: The CSS references /assets/generated/iphone-watermark.dim_1600x1600.png, but the diff shows no added files, so the required generated image asset is not evidenced as being included.
evidence: File diff summary: ADDED FILES: none

hallucinated_features.description: Global visual theme/palette adjustments (OKLCH warm retail palette variables and related styling changes) beyond the watermark requirement.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest asked only for contact detail updates and a site-wide watermark, and explicitly discouraged redesign beyond what is needed. The index.css changes include extensive theme variable definitions and styling not strictly necessary to implement the watermark or contact text updates.
